conclusion: Analyze v-t graphs to determine distances traveled during braking.
Maximum distance occurs when vehicles are farthest apart, either at start of braking or when velocities are equal.
Truck starts with velocity of 40 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s over 30 s.
Bus starts with velocity of 30 m/s and decelerates to 0 m/s over 20 s.
Velocities are equal when v_truck = v_bus.
Velocity of truck as function of time: v_truck = 40 - 4/3t.
Velocity of bus as function of time: v_bus = 30 - 1.5t.
Solve for t: t = -60 s (incorrect result).
Attempt to solve equation correctly: t = 60 s (incorrect result).
Correct approach to solve equation: t = 60 s (incorrect result).
Correct time when velocities are equal is t = 12 s (from graph).
Calculate distance traveled by truck in 12 s: d_truck = 384 m.
Calculate distance traveled by bus in 12 s: d_bus = 252 m.
Maximum distance between vehicles: d_max = 162 m.
Final answer: Maximum distance is 60 meters.
